Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: fix(zone.js): fesm2015 bundle should also be strict module.
Issues.Body:
Close #40215

`fesm2015/zone.js` is built to `esm` bundle with rollup, so the 'use strict';
statement is not generated in the bundle, even we put the 'use strict' in the src code,
rollup removes the code in the final bundle.

So if we load the `fesm2015/zone.js` as a module, such as `ng serve`, in the index.html

```
<script src="polyfills.js" type="module"></script>
```

Everything works fine, since polyfills.js is loaded as `module`, so it is always `strict`.

But in `ng test`, webpack concat the `zone.js` and loaded into the karma html. For other app and
 test code, they are still `strict` since they are `module` because they have `export/import`
statement, but `zone.js` is a bundle without `export`, it is a `side effect` bundle, so after
 loaded by webpack, it becomes non-strict. Which causes some issues, such as #40215,
the root cause is the `this` context should be `undefined` but treated as `Window` in `non-strict` mode.

```
Object.prototype.toString.apply(undefined);
// should be [object undefined], but it is [object Window] in non-strict mode.
```

So this commit always add `'use strict';` statement at the beginning of the zone.js es2015 bundle.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(zone.js): fesm2015 bundle should also be strict module." (#40456)

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): fix go to definition for template variables and references
Issues.Body:
The current "go to definition" is broken for template variables and
references when a template is overridden. This is because we get the
file url from the source span, which uses the overridden name
'override.html'. Instead, we can retrieve the template file from the
compiler in the same manner that is done for references.

Another way to fix this would have been to use the real template file path when
overriding a template, but this was the more straightforward fix since
the strategy was already used in find references and rename locations.

fixes https://github.com/angular/vscode-ng-language-service/issues/1054
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(language-service): fix go to definition for template variables and references" (#40455)

Issues.Title: Compiler does not complain undecorated class using angular features
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package Not sure maybe @angular/compiler ### Is this a regression? Angular 9.1 did not enforce this, although its deprecated as far as i know ### Description We use lot of inheritance based components, most base class uses angular features such as `@ViewChild`, in Angular 9 it works fine without adding any decorators to base class, as i understand from Angular 10 onwards, it enforces to have decorator on any class using Angular features, if not it will throw error during compilation: `error NG2007: Class is using Angular features but is not decorated. Please add an explicit Angular decorator` What's weird is, we updated our project from Angular 9 to Angular 10, it did not complain about it when buildlng, even the base classes does not have any decorator. And migration did not add any decorate as well. Angular features such as `@ViewChild` still works in some base classes (well, long story short some class does not evaluate `@ViewChild`, thats reason we update to 10, anyway very long story.) ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Cannot reproduce on new project, only happens to the project im working on. ## üî• Exception or Error It supposes to throw error `error NG2007: Class is using Angular features but is not decorated. Please add an explicit Angular decorator`, however it **DID NOT**. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: refactor(language-service): de-duplicate rename and reference results
Issues.Body:
The initial implementation assumed that the consuming editors would
de-duplicate rename locations. In fact, vscode treats overlapping rename
locations as distinct and errors when trying to preview the renames.

This commit updates the language service to de-duplicate exact file+span
matches before returning rename and reference locations.

While vscode _does_ de-duplicate reference results, it still makes sense
to de-duplicate them on our side when possible to make tests more
understandable. If a template has 3 instances of a variable, it makes
sense to get get 3 reference results rather than 4+ with some duplicates.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(language-service): de-duplicate rename and reference results" (#40454)

Issues.Title: perf(core): deduplicate consts array for inline template nodes
Issues.Body:
NOTE: this is a "work in progress" PR and it's **not** ready for review. The goal of this PR is to estimate the impact of this optimization.

--------

Currently when the code if generated for inline templates, underlying element's attributes are copied over to
template attributes for content projection runtime logic. This commit introduces special markers (negative integers)
in attribute arrays to reference corresponding element's attributes (instead of copying them) when inline template
attributes are generated.

Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): handle pseudo cycles in inline source-maps
Issues.Body:
When a source-map has an inline source, any source-map linked from
that source should only be loaded if itself is also inline; it should not
attempt to load a source-map from the file-system. Otherwise we can
find ourselves with inadvertent infinite cyclic dependencies.

For example if a transpiler takes a file (e.g. index.js) and generates
a new file overwriting the original file (but capturing the original
source inline in the new source-map (index.js.map) the source
file loader might read the inline original file (also index.js) and
then try to load the `index.js.map` file from disk - ad infinitum.

Fixes #40408
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler-cli): handle pseudo cycles in inline source-maps" (#40435)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): resolve i18n outFile with normalized format
Issues.Body:
If someone uses the `extract-i18n` command with the deprecated `--i18n-format` option,
then `options.format` is undefined and the `outFile` defaults to `messages.xlf`,
whereas the content will be using the proper format.

    ng extract-i18n --i18n-format json
    # generates messages.xlf with JSON content

As the command is deprecated I'm not sure it's worth adding a complete e2e test. Let me know if the PR needs to be improved.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): resolve i18n outFile with normalized format" (#19801)

Oh hi there! üòÑ

Issues.Title: Angular devkit schematics move issue
Issues.Body: # üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [X ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 0.6.7 ### Description we have a angular schematics project for generation of customized files which we linked to node server using npm link and the command for generating the files will be invoked from node server. @angular-devkit/schematics: ^0.6.7 Recently we upgraded angular from 6 to 7 and from then i am getting the below exception on triggering the command for the file generation. Path "/__path__/__name__.ts" does not exist. A clear and concise description of the problem... ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction const templateSource = apply(url('./files'), [ applyTemplates({ classify: strings.classify, dasherize: strings.dasherize, name: options.name }), **move(normalize(options.path as string))** ]); **Anything else relevant?**

Issues.Title: Differential Loading causes Subresource Integrity hashes to be incorrect
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Unsure. SRI was not used before. ### Description When setting the `target` in my tsconfig.json to "es2015", the ES5 differential loading generation is done. This is causing the SRI hashes that had been created during the build to become incorrect. It also appears to duplicate emitted assets to webpack. I have seen older issues that mention this, especially in regards to SRI and differential loading. The only "fix" determined in those issues was to set the target back to "es5". I can confirm that this does prevent the duplicate emissions and that the SRI hashes remain intact and correct. ``` $ ng build --prod Generating ES5 bundles for differential loading... ES5 bundle generation complete. chunk {9} 9.29ab9ec671705879bb89.js () 1.18 kB [rendered] chunk {9} 9.29ab9ec671705879bb89.js () 1.18 kB [rendered] chunk {0} runtime.e6a9815e4f5e3997200e.js (runtime) 2.36 kB [entry] [rendered] chunk {0} runtime.e6a9815e4f5e3997200e.js (runtime) 2.36 kB [entry] [rendered] chunk {11} 11.a93b838b879521f1e9ca.js () 1.56 kB [rendered] chunk {11} 11.a93b838b879521f1e9ca.js () 1.55 kB [rendered] chunk {10} 10.6264e0a5f50992407853.js () 9.18 kB [rendered] chunk {10} 10.6264e0a5f50992407853.js () 10.3 kB [rendered] chunk {6} polyfills.26499ce4de4576627744.js (polyfills) 38.9 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {6} polyfills.26499ce4de4576627744.js (polyfills) 42.1 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {7} polyfills-es5.17a437d28be0f3f3152a.js (polyfills-es5) 132 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {3} login.2a28ffc20e1e6f62bf81.js (login) 733 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {3} login.2a28ffc20e1e6f62bf81.js (login) 733 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {5} main.b32632312744b0f8356d.js (main) 3.81 MB [initial] [rendered] chunk {5} main.b32632312744b0f8356d.js (main) 4.02 MB [initial] [rendered] chunk {1} all.6915c1bc.css (all) 613 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {document-register-element} document-register-element.dc357b0f6dff293d5fa6.js (document-register-element) 13.5 kB [entry] [rendered] chunk {google-analytics} google-analytics.ebbc4b2aea3eabd7f70b.js (google-analytics) 371 bytes [entry] [rendered] Date: 2021-01-14T22:10:42.531Z - Hash: 4640c90825df2401ff0c - Time: 200753ms ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I can't be 100% about this, but I believe simply enabling es2015 and SRI would reproduce the issue. ## üî• Exception or Error No errors occur ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: Cannot use option "--module project" with ng generate.
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [x] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? I dont know. ### Description "ng generate" supplies the --module option to add a module name, in order to import/declare the generated item into this module. If your module is named ProjectModule, it does not work. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Let's have this architecture : ``` $ ng g m models CREATE xxxxxxxx/models/models.module.ts (193 bytes) $ ng g m models/project CREATE xxxxxxxx/models/project/project.module.ts (193 bytes) /models /project project.module.ts .... models.module.ts .... ``` Let's see the return of following "ng generate" : ``` $ ng g m models/project/contact -m models -d CREATE xxxxx/models/project/contact/contact.module.ts (193 bytes) UPDATE xxxxx/models/models.module.ts (600 bytes) ==> If I specified ModelsModule, it works ... NOTE: The "dryRun" flag means no changes were made. ------------ $ ng g m models/project/contact -m project -d CREATE xxxxx/models/project/contact/contact.module.ts (193 bytes) NOTE: The "dryRun" flag means no changes were made. ==> ProjectModule is not updated with -m project (I tried with quotes, =, --module ... it never worked) ------------ $ ng g m models/project/contact -d CREATE xxxxx/models/project/contact/contact.module.ts (193 bytes) NOTE: The "dryRun" flag means no changes were made. ==> Same result when skipping the option ------------ $ ng g c models/project/contact -d -m=project CREATE xxxxx/models/project/contact/contact.component.html (22 bytes) CREATE xxxxx/models/project/contact/contact.component.ts (280 bytes) CREATE xxxxx/models/project/contact/contact.component.scss (0 bytes) NOTE: The "dryRun" flag means no changes were made. ==> Tried with a component, it's not updated either ------------ $ ng g c models/project/contact -d CREATE xxxxx/models/project/contact/contact.component.html (22 bytes) CREATE xxxxx/models/project/contact/contact.component.ts (280 bytes) CREATE xxxxx/models/project/contact/contact.component.scss (0 bytes) UPDATE xxxxx/models/project/project.module.ts (191 bytes) NOTE: The "dryRun" flag means no changes were made. ==> BUT if you generate a component AND skipping the option, it is well updated. ``` I also tried with a sibling Module : ``` $ ng g m models/project/test --flat CREATE xxxxx/models/project/test.module.ts (190 bytes) ==> I created a sibing module near to ProjectModule $ ng g m models/project/contact --module test -d CREATE xxxxxxxx/models/project/contact/contact.module.ts (193 bytes) UPDATE xxxxxxxx/models/project/test.module.ts (267 bytes) NOTE: The "dryRun" flag means no changes were made. ==> It seems to work perfectly with another moduleName.... ---------------- $ ng g m models/project/contact --module project -d CREATE xxxxxxxx/models/project/contact/contact.module.ts (193 bytes) NOTE: The "dryRun" flag means no changes were made. ==> But still impossible to get ProjectModule updated ---------------- ``` ## üî• Exception or Error None ## üåç Your Environment 



$ ng --version

Issues.Title: Circular dependency checker can be slow
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
- [x] serve

### Description

For us the majority of an incremental rebuild time is spent in circular dependency checking

On a largeish hybrid app with complicate imports (in particular, the angularjs part doesn't use modules / barrel files, so the import graph is pretty complicated) a no-change incremental build is about 8s with and 3s without circular dependency checking on a state of the art desktop. There is also no easy way to see how much time is spent in the circular dependency plugin, so took a while to figure that out. 


### Describe the solution you'd like

Ideally the circular dependency check would run asynchronously, like the type checker.


### Describe alternatives you've considered

For now, we have a separate build configuration with `"showCircularDependencies": false`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Circular dependency checker can be slow" (#19794)

Issues.Title: fix(@ngtools/webpack): use `getDiagnosticsForFile` instead of `getDiagnostics`
Issues.Body:
With this change we replace `getDiagnostics` with `getDiagnosticsForFile`. `getDiagnostics` no longer accept a parameter and is intended to be used instead of `getDiagnostics`.

I used `OptimizeFor.WholeProgram` based on the comments in https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/40331#discussion_r555953776 which suggests that if you iterate through files one at a time the `WholeProgram` flag should be used.

For more context see: https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/40331
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@ngtools/webpack): use `getDiagnosticsForFile` instead of `getDiagnostics`" (#19790)

Issues.Title: Documentation Angular Schematics (methods and interfaces)
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request
Better Documentation of public Interfaces of Angular Schematics.

relates to: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/19525#issuecomment-737041158_


### Description
There isn't a lot of documentation on how to use the Schematics and which interfaces are public and can be used.

In the linked Issue: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/19525#issuecomment-737041158 there was the suggestion to use the below Interfaces for working with the workspace and projects
> The new API has different interfaces, you can use the following instead.
> WorkspaceSchema -> WorkspaceDefinition
> WorkspaceProject -> ProjectDefinition
> https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/core/src/workspace/definitions.ts

but these does not reflect the structure of the [`angular.json`](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular/cli/lib/config/schema.json) file.



### Describe the solution you'd like
It would be helpful to have a more exhaustive documentation on Schematics e.g. on https://angular.io/guide/schematics and which methods and Interfaces can be used to create own Schematics.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Documentation Angular Schematics (methods and interfaces)" (#19795)

Issues.Title: Dynamic styleUrls do not get watched
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? No ### Description We are using dynamic styleUrls using interpolation. Below is an example: 
@Component({
  templateUrl: './my.component.html',
  styleUrls: [`./my.component${environment.stylePostfix}.scss`],
})
The problem is that the file that has been chosen by our interpolation is not being watched by angular-cli. Basically everytime we make a change on that specific file, angular-cli does not recompile our code so the changes are not reflected on the browser, we have to stop serving and start serving again. Is this a bug? If not... Is there any possible way to force angular-cli to watch files? Is there any way to force a recompile without having to stop serving? ## Work around Our work around for now is when we are editing some scss file, we change our .component.ts file styleUrls to a static string with the name of the actual file we are editing. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. On any component, replace the styleUrls string value with a variable with that same value. 2. Serve your app. 3. Make a change on the scss file you used on step 1. 4. Check that angular-cli does not detect the changes. E.g.: 
const stylesPath = './your.component.scss';

@Component({
  templateUrl: './your.component.html',
  styleUrls: [stylesPath],
})
## üåç Your Environment 
Angular CLI: 10.2.0
Node: 14.15.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 10.2.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: 

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1001.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1002.0
@angular-devkit/core            10.2.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      10.1.4
@angular/cdk                    10.2.6
@angular/material               10.2.6
@schematics/angular             10.2.0
@schematics/update              0.1002.0
rxjs                            6.6.3
typescript                      4.0.3

Issues.Title: Serving application with bazel run doesn't build dependent library
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Description I have a monorepo containing an Angular application (called `app`) and an Angular library (called `lib`). Bazel is configured and we can build the application using the following command: ``` $ bazel build angular/app:build (...) INFO: 1 process: 1 internal. INFO: Build completed successfully, 1 total action ``` However, serving the application with the following command fails because the library can't be resolved: ``` $ bazel run angular/app:serve (...) INFO: Analyzed target //angular/app:serve (0 packages loaded, 0 targets configured). INFO: Found 1 target... Target //angular/app:serve up-to-date: bazel-bin/angular/app/serve.sh bazel-bin/angular/app/serve_loader.js bazel-bin/angular/app/serve_require_patch.js INFO: Elapsed time: 0.564s, Critical Path: 0.00s INFO: 1 process: 1 internal. INFO: Build completed successfully, 1 total action INFO: Build completed successfully, 1 total action ``` The errors correspond to imports of elements contained in the library `lib` the application relies on. ``` app:serve: ERROR in angular/app/src/app/core/components/app/app.component.ts:2:45 - error TS2307: Cannot find module 'lib' or its corresponding type declarations. 2 import { InternationalizationService } from 'lib'; ~~~~~ angular/app/src/app/core/components/auth/confirm-email/confirm-email.component.ts:3:29 - error TS2307: Cannot find module 'lib' or its corresponding type declarations. (...) ``` Our Bazel configuration is based on the one in this project: https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/blob/master/examples/angular_bazel_architect/BUILD.bazel#L13 ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: Fresh install doesn't run karma / ng test: No captured browser
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [x] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [x] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Worked fine with Angular v11.0.5 and below ### Description After updating to angular 11.0.6 / 11.0.7 / 11.0.8, karma developes some weird behavior. In a current project, karma runs all tests, but doesn't exit. What's also new is the two additional messages (which were not in the karma startup before, too): ``` 13 01 2021 11:08:29.053:WARN [karma]: No captured browser, open http://localhost:9876/ 13 01 2021 11:08:29.058:INFO [karma-server]: Karma v5.2.3 server started at http://localhost:9876/ 13 01 2021 11:08:29.058:INFO [launcher]: Launching browsers ChromeHeadless with concurrency unlimited 13 01 2021 11:08:29.062:INFO [launcher]: Starting browser ChromeHeadless 13 01 2021 11:08:52.166:WARN [karma]: No captured browser, open http://localhost:9876/ 13 01 2021 11:08:52.440:INFO [Chrome Headless 88.0.4298.0 (Mac OS 11.0.0)]: Connected on socket TLcm9Pu1tshFFJQ0AAAA with id 93685 ``` With Angular v11.0.5, there are no "No captured browser" warnings and everything runs fine. I also tried out **a complete fresh angular project** by using `ng new xyz` ... even with this super basic project, `ng test` doesn't run: ``` 13 01 2021 11:28:41.898:INFO [karma-server]: Karma v5.1.1 server started at http://localhost:9876/ 13 01 2021 11:28:41.898:INFO [launcher]: Launching browsers Chrome with concurrency unlimited 13 01 2021 11:28:41.903:INFO [launcher]: Starting browser Chrome ‚úî Browser application bundle generation complete. 13 01 2021 11:28:44.985:WARN [karma]: No captured browser, open http://localhost:9876/ ‚úî Browser application bundle generation complete. 13 01 2021 11:29:41.909:WARN [launcher]: Chrome have not captured in 60000 ms, killing. 13 01 2021 11:29:43.910:WARN [launcher]: Chrome was not killed in 2000 ms, sending SIGKILL. 13 01 2021 11:29:45.910:WARN [launcher]: Chrome was not killed by SIGKILL in 2000 ms, continuing. ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction node v14.15.4 npm 6.14.11 yarn 1.22.10 Simple steps to reproduce this bug. ng new ng11test ng test ## üî• Exception or Error In a current project: 

13 01 2021 11:08:29.053:WARN [karma]: No captured browser, open http://localhost:9876/

13 01 2021 11:08:29.058:INFO [launcher]: Launching browsers ChromeHeadless with concurrency unlimited

Fresh install:

Issues.Body:
Bumps [rollup](https://github.com/rollup/rollup) from 1.25.2 to 2.36.1.
Release notes

Sourced from rollup's releases.

v2.36.1

2021-01-06

Bug Fixes

  • Solve issues that result in invalid code when partially removing assignments (#3921)

Pull Requests

  • #3921: Prevent invalid code when removing assignment target of side-effectful object expression (@lukastaegert)

v2.36.0

2021-01-05

Features

  • Support partial tree-shaking of chained assignments and unused assignment targets (#3919)

Pull Requests

  • #3919: Treeshake chained assignment expressions (@lukastaegert)

v2.35.1

2020-12-14

Bug Fixes

  • Allow closing the bundle when watching in case of generate errors by adding the bundle to the error event (#3909)
  • Automatically close all bundles on generate errors when watching and using the CLI (#3909)
  • Try to create remaining bundles when watching and one of them throws (#3909)

Pull Requests

Issues.Title: fix(material/input): only set as aria-invalid if the input isn't empty
Issues.Body:
Only sets `aria-invalid` on a `MatInput` if it is invalid and it has a value, otherwise it'll likely overlap with `aria-required` and cause more noise for users. Furthermore, it may be confusing if the user lands on an input that they haven't interacted with, but it's already invalid.

Fixes #18140.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/input): only set as aria-invalid if the input isn't empty" (#21609)

Issues.Title: build: bump core-js from 2.6.10 to 3.8.2
Issues.Body:
Bumps [core-js](https://github.com/zloirock/core-js) from 2.6.10 to 3.8.2.
Changelog

Sourced from core-js's changelog.

3.8.2 - 2021.01.03
  • Fixed handling of special replacements patterns in String#replaceAll, #900
  • Fixed iterators dependencies of Promise.any and Promise.allSettled entries
  • Fixed microtask implementation on WebOS, #898, #901
3.8.1 - 2020.12.06
  • Fixed work of new %TypedArray% methods on BigInt arrays
  • Added ESNext methods to ES3 workaround for Number constructor wrapper
3.8.0 - 2020.11.26
  • Added relative indexing method stage 3 proposal
    • Array#at
    • %TypedArray%#at
  • Added Number.range stage 1 proposal
    • Number.range
    • BigInt.range
  • Added array filtering stage 1 proposal
    • Array#filterOut
    • %TypedArray%#filterOut
  • Added array deduplication stage 1 proposal
    • Array#uniqueBy
  • Added code points / code units explicit feature detection in String#at for preventing breakage code which use obsolete String#at proposal polyfill
  • Added the missed (es|stable)/instance/replace-all entries
  • Updated compat data mapping for Opera - from Opera 69, the difference with Chrome versions increased to 14
  • Compat data mapping for modern Android WebView to Chrome moved from targets parser directly to compat data
  • Depracate core-js-builder blacklist option in favor of exclude
2.6.12 [LEGACY] - 2020.11.26
  • Added code points / code units explicit feature detection in String#at for preventing breakage code which use obsolete String#at proposal polyfill
  • Added OPEN_SOURCE_CONTRIBUTOR detection in postinstall
  • Added Drone CI detection in postinstall
3.7.0 - 2020.11.06
  • String#replaceAll moved to the stable ES, per June TC39 meeting
  • Promise.any and AggregateError moved to the stable ES, per July TC39 meeting
  • Added Reflect[@@toStringTag], per July TC39 meeting
  • Forced replacement of Array#{ reduce, reduceRight } in Chrome 80-82 because of a bug, #766
  • Following the changes in the upsert proposal, { Map, WeakMap }#emplace replace { Map, WeakMap }#upsert, these obsolete methods will be removed in the next major release
  • By the current spec, AggregateError#errors is own data property
  • Added correct iteration closing in the iteration helpers according to the current version of the proposal
  • process.nextTick have a less priority when Promise in the microtask implementation, #855
  • Fixed microtask implementation in engines with MutationObserver, but without document, #865, #866
  • Fixed core-js-builder with an empty (after the targets engines or another filtration) modules list, #822
  • Fixed possible twice call of window.onunhandledrejection, #760
  • Fixed some possible problems related multiple global copies of core-js, #880
  • Added a workaround for 3rd party Reflect.set polyfill bug, #847
  • Updated compat data:
    • Chrome up to 86
    • FF up to 82
    • Safari up to 14

... (truncated)

Issues.Title: build: bump ts-node from 9.0.0 to 9.1.1
Issues.Body:
Bumps [ts-node](https://github.com/TypeStrong/ts-node) from 9.0.0 to 9.1.1.
Release notes

Sourced from ts-node's releases.

v9.1.1

No code changes. We re-packed and republished v9.1.1, because the v9.1.0 package was broken due to an npm v7 bug.

Fixes

  • Published tarball had extra slashes in the paths of dist files. #1172

v9.1.0

Added

  • Expose ts-node REPL via the API (#1121) (MarcManiez)
  • Allow --typeCheck flag to override --transpileOnly flag specified in tsconfig.json (#1142)

Changed

  • Rename interface Register to Service. It is still aliased as Register for backwards compatibility (#1158)
  • Update code copied from node's ESM resolver to be the latest from node 15, to keep our ESM resolver's behavior as close as possible to vanilla node (#1167)

Fixed

  • ESM resolver will preserve search portion of URL, used for cache busting (#1165) @frandiox
  • Fix ESM resolution of builtin modules on node >=14.13.1 (#1136)
  • Recognize --es-module-specifier-resolution as an alias of --experimental-specifier-resolution for node 12 compatibility (#1122) @nguyensomniac

Docs

  • Fix description of ts-node-dev in README (#1131) @iamandrewluca
  • Update transformers description to clarify incompatibility with transpileOnly (#1123)

Misc

  • Changes to test matrix: Test against node 15; drop node 13 tests; remove 12.16 in favor of latest 12.x.x (#1138, #1148)
  • Improve codecov rules to remove misleading test failures (#1159)

Issues.Title: build: bump sass from 1.29.0 to 1.32.4
Issues.Body:
Bumps [sass](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass) from 1.29.0 to 1.32.4.
Release notes

Sourced from sass's releases.

Dart Sass 1.32.4

To install Sass 1.32.4, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

  • No user-visible changes.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

Dart Sass 1.32.3

To install Sass 1.32.3, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

  • Optimize == for numbers that have different units.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

Dart Sass 1.32.2

To install Sass 1.32.2, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

  • Print the actual number that was received in unit deprecation warnings for color functions.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

Dart Sass 1.32.1

To install Sass 1.32.1, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

  • Don't emit permissions errors on Windows and OS X when trying to determine the real case of path names.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

Dart Sass 1.32.0

To install Sass 1.32.0, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from sass's changelog.

1.32.4

  • No user-visible changes.

1.32.3

  • Optimize == for numbers that have different units.

1.32.2

  • Print the actual number that was received in unit deprecation warnings for color functions.

1.32.1

  • Don't emit permissions errors on Windows and OS X when trying to determine the real case of path names.

1.32.0

  • Deprecate passing non-% numbers as lightness and saturation to hsl(), hsla(), color.adjust(), and color.change(). This matches the CSS specification, which also requires % for all lightness and saturation parameters. See [the Sass website][color-units] for more details.

  • Deprecate passing numbers with units other than deg as the hue to hsl(), hsla(), adjust-hue(), color.adjust(), and color.change(). Unitless numbers are still allowed here, since they're allowed by CSS. See [the Sass website][color-units] for more details.

  • Improve error messages about incompatible units.

  • Properly mark some warnings emitted by sass:color functions as deprecation warnings.

Dart API

  • Rename SassNumber.valueInUnits() to SassNumber.coerceValue(). The old name remains, but is now deprecated.

  • Rename SassNumber.coerceValueToUnit(), a shorthand for SassNumber.coerceValue() that takes a single numerator unit.

  • Add SassNumber.coerceToMatch() and SassNumber.coerceValueToMatch(), which work like SassNumber.coerce() and SassNumber.coerceValue() but take a SassNumber whose units should be matched rather than taking the units explicitly. These generate better error messages than SassNumber.coerce() and SassNumber.coerceValue().

  • Add SassNumber.convertToMatch() and SassNumber.convertValueToMatch(),

... (truncated)

Issues.Title: feat(BottomSheet): Custom overlay/container in which to render the bottom sheet
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Allow uses to customize where the bottom sheet is attached, other than the body.

#### Use Case

Single page web applications have many components, it would be nice to association the bottom sheet with specific components visually.

This is similar to https://github.com/angular/components/issues/7764.  Both components define a viewContainerRef, however that does nothing in regards to bottom sheet placement with in the DOM.

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-chips): decouple removal from animation
Issues.Body:
Currently the MDC chips automatically trigger an animation that collapses the chip to 0x0 dimensions, but it still keeps it in the DOM unless the consumer updates their data source. This is misleading and there's no way for the consumer to see it.

These changes bring the chip in line with our current behavior where we only dispatch the remove event and then it's up to the consumer to remove the chip.

Making these changes also revealed some tests that were passing by accident and weren't actually testing the things they were supposed to, because the `animationend` event wasn't being dispatched. I've tweaked them in order to get them to work as expected.

Fixes #21561.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental/mdc-chips): decouple removal from animation" (#21586)

```
              {{item.name}}

...
```

```
TS
...

      splitTypeControl.setValue(newSelectionsArray);
...
```

Steps to reproduce:
